unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate the ability to work in a group setting to address a research problem in cognitive science.
Demonstrate effective scientific communication in written and oral form for a variety of audiences.
Demonstrate analytical research skills with intellectual independence.
Identify and critically review major concepts, theoretical perspectives, empirical findings and historical trends in sensation and perception research.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Preparation for weekly seminar (12 weeks x 3 hours)

assessments.description: Essay (1500 words) on a topic relating to one of the unit's modules.
Essay (1500 words) on a topic relating to one of the unit's modules.
A presentation (20 minutes) on a topic assigned by the unit convenor.

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit forms part of a four-unit core sequence covering a range of foundational and cutting- edge research topics in cognitive science, with an emphasis on active research programs at MQ. This team-taught unit is made up of a selection of 3-4 topic modules, led by experts specialising in these fields. Topics to be covered may include but are not limited to: the cognitive and brain mechanisms of visual, auditory, somatosensory and action perception.
